intro: Linnaeopsis heckmanniana, commonly known as the Mexican flame violet, is a striking epiphytic orchid native to the cloud forests of Mexico. It features showy, brightly colored flowers that range from red to orange, with intricate patterns resembling flames. The plant has fleshy, dark green leaves that are often covered in a waxy coating, aiding in water retention. It thrives in humid, shaded environments and requires well-drained, organic-rich substrates. Linnaeopsis heckmanniana is prized for its ornamental value and is often cultivated in tropical gardens and greenhouses.
